clinical_study.brief_title: Short-term Effects of Tai Chi Chuan Exercise on the Regulation of Lipid and Glucose Metabolisms and Endothelial Function
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Tai Chi Chuan on the Endothelin, Insulin, Blood Lipid, Blood Sugar, Aldosterone and Hemodynamics in the Elderly Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The short term effects of TCC exercise are the significant increase in serum insulin and insulin resistance, and the significant decrease in serum TC, HDL-C, ET-1 and insulin sensitivity in TCC practitioners. TCC might be benefit the health of its practitioners through the regulation of lipid and glucose metabolism and endothelial function.

detailed_description.textblock: Tai Chi Chuan (TCC) has been shown to be beneficial to the health. However, its effects on lipid and glucose metabolism are not fully understood. This study investigated the short term effect of TCC exercise on lipid and glucose metabolism and endothelial function in TCC practitioners. Twenty-one TCC practitioners and nineteen normal controls were included in this study. The hemodynamics, serum insulin, indices of insulin resistance/sensitivity, serum endothelin-1 (ET-1), blood lipids and aldosterone before and 30 min after a rest or a session of classical Yang's TCC exercise were compared.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Twenty-one TCC practitioners and nineteen normal controls were included in this study. The hemodynamics, serum insulin, indices of insulin resistance/sensitivity, serum endothelin-1 (ET-1), blood lipids and aldosterone before and 30 min after a rest or a session of classical Yang's TCC exercise were compared.

primary_outcome.measure: change in quantitative insulin sensitivity check index
primary_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
primary_outcome.description: change in insulin sensitivity due to TCC

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
secondary_outcome.description: change in serum total cholesterol due to TCC

secondary_outcome.measure: change in homeostasis model assessment-estimated insulin resistance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
secondary_outcome.description: change in insulin resistance by TCC

other_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
other_outcome.description: change in serum level of triglyceride due to TCC

other_outcome.measure: change in serum low density lipoprotein
other_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
other_outcome.description: change in serum level of low density lipoprotein due to TCC

other_outcome.measure: change in serum high density lipoprotein
other_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
other_outcome.description: change in serum level of high density lipoprotein due to TCC

other_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
other_outcome.description: change in serum level of insulin due to TCC

other_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
other_outcome.description: change in serum level of endothelin-1 due to TCC

other_outcome.time_frame: before and 30 minutes after the completion of TCC exercise
other_outcome.description: change in serum level of aldosterone due to TCC

clinical_study.condition: Physiological Effect of TCC on Glucose Metabolism

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- TCC practitioners in a TCC training center in Taiwan over 50 years of age
- Healthy subjects without TCC experience over 50 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who had major cardiopulmonary disease
- Subjects who have diabetes mellitus, renal or liver disease
